emerging_technologies.name: AI-Driven Software Development
emerging_technologies.description: AI systems capable of autonomously developing and optimizing software, integrating with blockchain for secure, transparent development processes.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Reduces human error in software development, accelerates innovation, and changes the job market for programmers. Ethical concerns around AI-generated code and intellectual property rights.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: High initial investment in AI infrastructure, need for new regulatory frameworks, and acceptance by the developer community.

emerging_technologies.name: Self-Sustaining Lunar Base
emerging_technologies.description: A lunar base that utilizes in-situ resource utilization (ISRU) to produce essentials like oxygen, water, and building materials autonomously.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Paves the way for long-term human habitation off Earth, stimulates space economy, and raises questions about lunar resource rights and international space law.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological breakthroughs in ISRU, international cooperation, funding, and overcoming the harsh lunar environment.

emerging_technologies.name: Neural Augmentation for Memory Storage
emerging_technologies.description: Implantable devices allowing individuals to record, store, and retrieve memories digitally, enhancing cognitive capabilities.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Potential to revolutionize education and entertainment, but raises ethical questions about privacy, identity, and memory manipulation.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Technological advancements in brain-computer interfaces, public acceptance, and regulatory frameworks for human augmentation.

emerging_technologies.name: Decentralized Energy Grids
emerging_technologies.description: Blockchain-based systems for managing and trading energy locally, enabling peer-to-peer energy transactions.
emerging_technologies.societal_implications: Promotes energy independence, reduces reliance on centralized power systems, and can democratize energy access but requires regulatory adjustments.
emerging_technologies.adoption_factors: Advancements in renewable energy technologies, consumer trust in blockchain, and regulatory support for decentralized energy systems.

mainstream_technologies.name: Electric Autonomous Vehicles
mainstream_technologies.description: Fully autonomous electric vehicles for both personal and public transport.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Widespread adoption due to government incentives, improved battery technology, and public demand for sustainable transport solutions.

mainstream_technologies.name: AI-Personalized Learning
mainstream_technologies.description: AI systems tailored to individual learning styles and needs, enhancing education outcomes.
mainstream_technologies.adoption_status: Growing adoption in schools and educational institutions, driven by the need for personalized education and data-driven teaching methods.

epoch_themes.description: Focus on making cities more sustainable through technology integration in infrastructure and resource management.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Improves quality of life, reduces environmental impact, and fosters economic growth through innovation in urban living.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Cities globally are adopting smart technologies to manage resources more efficiently, with a strong emphasis on reducing carbon footprints.

epoch_themes.description: Advancements in technologies that enhance human capabilities, both physically and cognitively.
epoch_themes.societal_impact: Changes the human experience, raises ethical debates, and requires new laws and regulations around human enhancement.
epoch_themes.global_trends: Increasing interest in personal enhancement, with a growing market for neurotechnology and AI assistance in daily life.
